definition: chastity/virginity (of women)/moral integrity (of men)/loyalty/constancy
chaste
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
memorial arch in honor of a chaste widow

sentences.english: Build chastity memorial arch to belie the truth of being a bitch.
sentences.chinese: 建一个贞节牌坊以掩盖她是女表子的实情。

sentences.english: If anything, her chastity will only attract such injuries.
sentences.chinese: 若是有什么的话，她的贞节只会吸引它受到伤害。

sentences.english: I am sure he is chaste as the moon is.
sentences.chinese: 我确信他是贞节的人，就像月亮一样贞洁。

sentences.english: Chastity, however, was beginning to mean something new in the period.
sentences.chinese: 然后贞节在那时开始意味着一些新的东西。

sentences.english: Pray for Christians to model Gods plan for sexual purity.
sentences.chinese: 愿基督徒依上帝的婚姻计划作贞节模范。

sentences.english: Dhastity is a wealth that comes from abundance of love.
sentences.chinese: 贞节是从富厚的爱情中娩出来的财富。

sentences.english: Although my virginity was a disadvantage, I stayed hopeful about dating.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我的贞节是一个缺点，我还是对约会充满了期待。

sentences.english: This tectonic plate highlights the people to the feminine chastity and national moral courage persevering.
sentences.chinese: 此板块凸显出人们对女性贞节和民族气节的坚守。

sentences.english: Women with great virtue in Shandong practiced the concept of virtue in different ways.
sentences.chinese: 山东守贞女性通过不同的行为模式践行其贞节观。

sentences.english: The most common arches here were those in honor of female chastity.
sentences.chinese: 而最多见的，则是为女人而建的“贞节”牌坊。

definition: chastity
ready to die to preserve one's chastity
(of a woman) indomitably chaste
(usually of women) chastity/virginity/virtue/honor/loyalty/moral integrity
memorial arch in honor of a chaste widow
a woman who dies fighting for her honor or follows her husband in death
faithful (to the memory of betrothed)/constant (of widow who remains unmarried)
female virgin/widow who does not remarry
Confucian code of ethics
reputation and integrity

Confucian moral injunctions for women, namely: obey in turn three men father, husband and son, plus the four virtues of morality 德, physical charm 容, propriety in speech 言 and efficiency in needlework 功
loyal and dependable
to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
(of a widow) faithful to the death to her husband's memory
etiquette/ceremonial rites
